Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of PRRA and H&C decisions
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed risk upon return to Algeria due to sexual orientation and perceived Jewish identity
Some evidence was ignored by the Officer
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of PRRA and H&C refusals
Court_Ruling: Cases remanded for re-determination by different officers
Defendant_Behavior: Made implicit credibility findings without oral hearing
Failed to fairly consider all evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk due to perceived Jewish identity
Legal_Standard: Correctness standard for procedural fairness and questions of law
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide oral hearing despite credibility concerns
Review_Standard: Correctness (for procedural fairness and legal questions)
Credibility_Assessment: Implicit credibility findings made without oral hearing
Evidence_Used: Applicant's statements regarding sexual orientation and religious perception
Supporting documents submitted with PRRA and H&C applications
Application_Basis: Personal risk due to membership in particular social group (sexual orientation)
Relief_Sought: Positive determination on PRRA and H&C applications
Governing_Rule: Officers must fairly consider all evidence
Oral hearing required if credibility is central issue
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of sufficient corroborative evidence demanded
Failure to assess available evidence properly
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution in Algeria based on sexual orientation and perceived religion
Cause_Description: Applicant faces deportation to Algeria where he claims he will be at risk due to being gay and perceived as Jewish
Evidence_Handling: Demand for additional evidence without justification
Legal_Provision_Violated: Sections of IRPA relating to procedural fairness and humanitarian considerations
Decision_Rationale: Failure to conduct proper credibility analysis
Evidentiary_Issues: No oral hearing provided despite credibility concerns
